ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This course was a good way to learn the structure of Spanish and how to speak it well. We focused more on conversation than just on specific vocabulary (though we learned that too). This is useful in real-life situations.
I learned the basics of the Spanish language through an introduction to reading, writing, and speaking Spanish.
I learned how to speak, read, write, and understand basic Spanish.
I learned some grammar and vocabulary and an ability to use that in spoken, written, and reading contexts.
Basic understanding of Spanish and basic Spanish speaking skills.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: good seminar interaction. Cold calling helped me stay engaged, but I never felt intimidated.
Weaknesses: none
No weaknesses! It was a lot of work but I think that was necessary.
Added flexibility to do with the taxing nature of zoom lessons or extra credit due to the term would have been helpful
I think this course should have been taught synchronously five days a week. That really would have helped me.
The course teaches you a lot but is very fast paced.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: It was good for COVID - seminars were interactive, and the professor was very available through email and office hours.
Online modules and homework assignments were helpful to back up in class learning.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes. Its a great intro to learning Spanish.
Yes, it was a fun class and a good way to get the functional basics

I would recommend this course. Having taken Spanish a bit in middle school, I found that even in the sections that were familiar there were still a lot of other interesting things like new vocabulary.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
